User Story: As a player, I want to view a list of items my character possesses so I know what they are carrying.
Acceptance Criteria:
The inventory UI displays a complete list of items associated with the character
Each item shows its name, quantity, and optional description
The inventory list is organized or grouped by categories
The inventory UI is responsive and works on different screen sizes
The inventory list refreshes automatically when items are added or removed
Technical Requirements: The system must display a complete list of a character's inventory items. Each item must show essential information including name, quantity, and description. The inventory display must support organization by categories and must be responsive across different screen sizes. The display must automatically update when inventory changes.
Implementation Considerations: Consider how to present inventory information clearly while maximizing space efficiency. Think about how grouping by categories can improve usability. The interface should update seamlessly when items are added or removed without interrupting user experience.

User Story: As a player, I want to add items to my character's inventory so they can use or equip them later.
Acceptance Criteria:
Items can be added to the character's inventory programmatically
When a new item is added, the inventory UI updates immediately
If an existing item is added, its quantity increases appropriately
The system tracks when and how items are acquired
New items are automatically categorized by the AI upon acquisition
Technical Requirements: The system must support adding new items to a character's inventory and updating quantities for existing items. It must integrate with the AI service for automatic item categorization. The system must track acquisition details including when and how items are acquired. The inventory display must update immediately when items are added.
Implementation Considerations: Consider how to identify when an item already exists in the inventory to properly handle quantity updates. Think about what acquisition metadata is most valuable for narrative purposes. The AI categorization process should handle cases where item descriptions are ambiguous.

User Story: As a player, I want to remove items from my character's inventory when they're no longer needed.
Acceptance Criteria:
Items can be removed from the character's inventory via the UI
When an item is removed, the inventory UI updates immediately
If a quantity is specified, only that amount is removed
When an item's quantity reaches zero, it is removed entirely from the inventory
The system provides confirmation for item removal to prevent accidents
Technical Requirements: The system must allow players to remove items from the character's inventory. It must handle partial quantity removal and complete item removal when quantities reach zero. The system must require confirmation before removing items to prevent accidental removal. The inventory display must update immediately after removal.
Implementation Considerations: Consider how to make the removal process intuitive while preventing accidental removals. Think about the appropriate level of confirmation needed based on item rarity or significance. The UI should clearly indicate the consequences of removal actions.

User Story: As a player, I want to use items from my inventory so they can affect the narrative.
Acceptance Criteria:
Players can select and use items from the inventory UI
Using an item triggers appropriate narrative effects via the Narrative Engine
The system provides feedback when an item is used
Used items that are consumable have their quantity reduced
Used items are reflected in the journal system if narratively significant
Technical Requirements: The system must allow players to use items from their inventory. Item usage must trigger appropriate effects in the narrative through the Narrative Engine. The system must provide clear feedback when items are used. For consumable items, quantities must decrease upon use. Significant item usage must be recorded in the journal system.
Implementation Considerations: Consider how item usage should be presented in the interface for maximum intuitiveness. Think about how the narrative engine should incorporate item usage into the story. The feedback system should make it clear what happened as a result of using the item.

User Story: As a player, I want used consumable items to be automatically removed from my inventory when depleted.
Acceptance Criteria:
The system identifies items that are consumable
Using a consumable item reduces its quantity by one
When a consumable item's quantity reaches zero, it is automatically removed from inventory
The inventory UI updates immediately when items are depleted
The system provides feedback when an item is depleted
Technical Requirements: The system must distinguish between consumable and non-consumable items. When consumable items are used, their quantity must decrease. Items with zero quantity must be automatically removed from the inventory. The system must provide feedback when items are fully depleted.
Implementation Considerations: Consider how to clearly indicate to the player which items are consumable. Think about whether depletion feedback should differ based on item significance. The automatic removal system should function seamlessly to maintain inventory accuracy.

User Story: As a player, I want to equip items from my inventory so my character can use them.
Acceptance Criteria:
Players can equip items from the inventory UI
Equipped items are marked with a clear visual indicator
Equipped status persists between game sessions
The system prevents equipping incompatible or unusable items
Equipping an item is reflected in the narrative context
Technical Requirements: The system must allow players to equip items from their inventory. Equipped items must be visually distinguished from unequipped items. The equipped status must persist between sessions. The system must prevent equipping incompatible items. The narrative engine must have access to equipped item information.
Implementation Considerations: Consider what visual indicators would best communicate equipped status. Think about basic compatibility rules to determine which items can be equipped. The persistence system should maintain equipped status across sessions while allowing for changing game states.

User Story: As a player, I want to unequip items when they're no longer needed.
Acceptance Criteria:
Players can unequip items from the inventory UI
Unequipped items remain in the inventory but lose equipped status
Unequipped status persists between game sessions
The system provides feedback when an item is unequipped
Unequipping an item is reflected in the narrative context
Technical Requirements: The system must allow players to unequip previously equipped items. Unequipped items must remain in the inventory but with updated status. The unequipped status must persist between sessions. The system must provide clear feedback when items are unequipped. The narrative engine must be informed of item unequipping.
Implementation Considerations: Consider whether the unequip action should be distinct or function as a toggle of the equip action. Think about appropriate feedback that indicates the item is no longer in use. The system should handle narrative transitions gracefully when items are unequipped.

User Story: As a player, I want to see which items are currently equipped at a glance.
Acceptance Criteria:
Equipped items have a clear, distinctive visual indicator in the inventory UI
The equipped status is immediately visible without additional interaction
The equipped indicator is consistent across all inventory views
The equipped indicator is accessible and visible across device sizes
Equipped status is updated immediately when changed
Technical Requirements: The system must visually distinguish equipped items from unequipped ones. This distinction must be immediately apparent without requiring additional user interaction. The visual indicators must be consistent throughout the interface and must work across different screen sizes. The indicator must update immediately when equipped status changes.
Implementation Considerations: Consider what visual treatment would most clearly indicate equipped status while maintaining good design aesthetics. Think about accessibility to ensure the equipped status is perceivable by all users. The indicator should be immediately understandable without requiring explanation.

User Story: As a player, I want items to be automatically categorized upon acquisition so they're easier to find.
Acceptance Criteria:
New items are automatically analyzed and categorized by the AI service
Items are assigned to predefined categories based on their description and properties
The categorization system handles a variety of item types effectively
Category assignments are stored with the item data
The system handles edge cases gracefully when categorization is unclear
Technical Requirements: The system must integrate with the AI service to analyze and categorize new items automatically. It must use a set of predefined inventory categories. The system must assign appropriate categories based on item descriptions and properties. It must handle edge cases gracefully when categorization is ambiguous.
Implementation Considerations: Consider what information about an item is most relevant for accurate categorization. Think about how to handle items that could fall into multiple categories. The system should have reasonable fallback mechanisms when AI categorization is unavailable or inconclusive.

User Story: As a player, I want to see item categories in the inventory view for better organization.
Acceptance Criteria:
The inventory UI displays items grouped by their categories
Category names are clearly visible as headers or labels
The category organization improves inventory navigation
Categories are consistently applied across the inventory UI
The category display adapts to different screen sizes
Technical Requirements: The system must group inventory items by their assigned categories in the UI. Category names must be clearly visible to users. The categorization must be consistently applied across all inventory views. The category display must adapt to different screen sizes while maintaining usability.
Implementation Considerations: Consider different approaches to visually organizing categories such as headers, sections, or tabs. Think about how to handle categories with many items versus those with few items. The organization should improve navigation and item finding while maintaining an uncluttered appearance.

User Story: As a player, I want the narrative to acknowledge the items my character has so the story feels personalized.
Acceptance Criteria:
The Narrative Engine has access to the character's inventory data
Narrative text references relevant items when appropriate
The system prioritizes narratively significant items for mentions
Item acknowledgment feels natural and integrated into the story
Item acknowledgment varies to avoid repetition
Technical Requirements: The system must provide the Narrative Engine with access to the character's inventory data. The narrative generation must reference relevant inventory items when contextually appropriate. The system must prioritize narratively significant items and vary references to avoid repetition.
Implementation Considerations: Consider what inventory data is most relevant for narrative personalization. Think about how to determine which items are most narratively significant in different contexts. The integration should feel natural rather than forced or mechanical.

User Story: As a player, I want my equipped items to be reflected in the narrative so my choices matter.
Acceptance Criteria:
The Narrative Engine distinguishes between equipped and unequipped items
Equipped items receive special consideration in narrative generation
Narrative text references equipped items when relevant to the story
Equipped items can influence possible narrative choices or outcomes
Changes to equipped items are reflected in subsequent narrative content
Technical Requirements: The system must distinguish between equipped and unequipped items when providing context to the Narrative Engine. Equipped items must receive special consideration in narrative generation. The system must ensure that equipped items can influence narrative choices and outcomes.
Implementation Considerations: Consider how the significance of equipped items should vary based on item type and story context. Think about how equipped item changes should be reflected in the narrative - immediate acknowledgment versus gradual incorporation. The narrative should distinguish between items that are merely possessed versus those actively equipped.
